segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Synchronize directory service data security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Synchronize directory service data security policy setting.

segment.source: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Synchronize directory service data security policy setting.
segment.target: Describes the best practices, location, values, policy management, and security considerations for the Synchronize directory service data security policy setting.

segment.source: This policy setting determines which users and groups have authority to synchronize all directory service data, regardless of the protection for objects and properties.
segment.target: This policy setting determines which users and groups have authority to synchronize all directory service data, regardless of the protection for objects and properties.

segment.source: This privilege is required to use LDAP directory synchronization (dirsync) services.
segment.target: This privilege is required to use LDAP directory synchronization (dirsync) services.

segment.source: Domain controllers have this user right inherently because the synchronization process runs in the context of the System account on domain controllers.
segment.target: Domain controllers have this user right inherently because the synchronization process runs in the context of the System account on domain controllers.

segment.source: Ensure that no accounts are assigned the Synchronize directory service data user right.
segment.target: Ensure that no accounts are assigned the Synchronize directory service data user right.

segment.source: Only domain controllers need this privilege, which they inherently have.
segment.target: Only domain controllers need this privilege, which they inherently have.

segment.source: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment
segment.target: Computer ConfigurationWindows SettingsSecurity SettingsLocal PoliciesUser Rights Assignment

segment.source: By default this setting is not defined on domain controllers and on stand-alone servers.
segment.target: By default this setting is not defined on domain controllers and on stand-alone servers.

segment.source: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.
segment.target: The following table lists the actual and effective default policy values.

segment.source: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.
segment.target: Default values are also listed on the policy’s property page.

segment.source: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.
segment.target: This section describes features, tools, and guidance to help you manage this policy.

segment.source: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.
segment.target: A restart of the device is not required for this policy setting to be effective.

segment.source: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.
segment.target: Any change to the user rights assignment for an account becomes effective the next time the owner of the account logs on.

segment.source: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:
segment.target: Settings are applied in the following order through a Group Policy Object (GPO), which will overwrite settings on the local computer at the next Group Policy update:

segment.source: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.
segment.target: When a local setting is greyed out, it indicates that a GPO currently controls that setting.

segment.source: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.
segment.target: This section describes how an attacker might exploit a feature or its configuration, how to implement the countermeasure, and the possible negative consequences of countermeasure implementation.

segment.source: The Synchronize directory service data user right affects domain controllers (only domain controllers should be able to synchronize directory service data).
segment.target: The Synchronize directory service data user right affects domain controllers (only domain controllers should be able to synchronize directory service data).

segment.source: Domain controllers have this user right inherently because the synchronization process runs in the context of the System account on domain controllers.
segment.target: Domain controllers have this user right inherently because the synchronization process runs in the context of the System account on domain controllers.

segment.source: Attackers who have this user right can view all information that is stored within the directory.
segment.target: Attackers who have this user right can view all information that is stored within the directory.

segment.source: They could then use some of that information to facilitate additional attacks or expose sensitive data, such as direct telephone numbers or physical addresses.
segment.target: They could then use some of that information to facilitate additional attacks or expose sensitive data, such as direct telephone numbers or physical addresses.

segment.source: Ensure that no accounts are assigned the Synchronize directory service data user right.
segment.target: Ensure that no accounts are assigned the Synchronize directory service data user right.

segment.source: Not defined is the default configuration.
segment.target: Not defined is the default configuration.
